author: travelandtourworld.com
title: China-ASEAN Expo to draw over 2,200 companiesTravelandtourworld.com
text:
China-ASEAN Expo to draw over 2,200 companies
The upcoming China-ASEAN Expo to be held in Nanning, capital of south China’s Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, from Sept 18 to 21 is expected to draw more than 2,200 companies from China and the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), organizers said on Thursday.
Hu Suojin, an official with China’s Ministry of Commerce said ore ASEAN exhibitors in competitive industries such as food and beverage and daily commodities, will bring their products to the expo this year, compared to past years.
Companies have applied for more than 5,500 booths at the expo, while 4,600 booths are planned.
The event is centered on cooperation on jointly building the 21st Century Maritime Silk Road.
27 forums on industrial cooperation, e-commerce, environmental protection, tourism, among other fields, will be held during the event.
Started in 2004, the expo serves as an important platform to promote bilateral trade and relationships between China and the ASEAN.
